result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey J Polansky

records.addlTxt:
SIGNATURE BOND MODIFIED ON 10/19/2022:  Defendant is not to have any VIOLENT contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.   The Court removes the GPS as a condition of bail.

PREVIOUS CONDITIONS:
Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

8:23 AM Defendant Jeffrey J Polansky in court.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court for Jeffrey J Polansky.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim A appeared in court.

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 

Attorney Ritter states that the Victim would like to amend conditions of bail.
The State does not object to hearing Victim's motion to modify. 
Victim A presents statements and requests a no violent contact with the Defendant. 
The Court questions Victim A.
ADA Zilavy presents statements and objects to any modification. 
Attorney Ritter presents statements and requests the Court to honor Victim A's request. 
The Court finds Victim A is freely, knowingly, and voluntarily requesting the no violent contact.
The Court grants Victim A's request and will modify bail.
Hearing scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.

1:23 PM Defendant Jeffrey J Polansky in court.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter not in court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.  Court notes Attorney Allison Ritter did file a notice of retainer and requested an adjournment of today's date.  The Court denied this request but informed Attorney Ritter she could appear by zoom.  Court conducts colloquy with the defendant.  The Court will set this matter within 20 days for preliminary hearing.  Court notes Attorney Ritter stated in her letter she has a hearing before Judge Bohren on October 19 at 9:00 am and will schedule the preliminary hearing on the 8:15 time block that morning.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Motion to adjourn**Reviewed by Commissioner David Herring on 10/6 "Denied, Attorney may appear by Zoom. Victim notification is an issue and the court will inquire as to whether Defendant is waiving right to Prelim in 20 days as time is currently tolled."
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on September 30, 2022.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms. Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 0.5 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

2:49 PM Defendant Jeffrey J Polansky in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez, as a friend of the court in court for Jeffrey J Polansky. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Court advises of right to an attorney. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
